15/10/2012      The Secretary-General attends the first summit on Arab-Asian cooperation held in Kuwait under the auspices of the Emir of Kuwait and the participation of 32 countries

- Highlights in the history of The League Of Arab States5/08/1942Egypt invited Iraq, Trans-Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Syria, Lebanon, and Yemen to send their representatives to exchange views on the issue of unity.  A Preparatory Committee, composed of these representatives in addition to a  representative of the Arabs of Palestine, held a two-week meeting in Alexandria thus launching what was known as the "Arab Unity Consultations" phase. 07/10/1944The Arab Unity Consultations led to the signing of the "Alexandria Protocol" by the heads of governments of Egypt, Trans-Jordan, Syria, Iraq and Lebanon.  This document included the principles for establishing and managing the organization which will group independent Arab states. These principles were later included in the Charter at a later stage. The signing ceremony of the Protocol was held at the Headquarters of the University of Alexandria (then Farouk Ist University).  The delegations of Saudi Arabia and Yemen deferred signing the Protocol until their governments took note of the text.  Saudi Arabia signed the document on 3/1/1945 followed by Yemen on 5/2/1945.03/03/1945"The Political Sub-Committee" established upon the recommendation of the "Alexandria Protocol" concluded its work after holding sixteen sessions at the office of the Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Alexandria.  Its members agreed on the text  of the "Charter of the League of Arab States" which was mainly based on the "Alexandria Protocol."  22/03/1945 The Heads of Governments of five Arab states, namely: Iraq, Trans-Jordan, Syria, Lebanon and Egypt signed the final version of the "Charter of the League of Arab States".   Saudi Arabia signed the original version at a later stage.   The Charter includes twenty articles that define the objectives of the Arab League and the framework of its system of work.  The signing ceremony of this historical document took place in the main hall of Al-"Za'faran" Palace in Cairo.  The Preparatory Committee decided to call the emerging organization "The League of Arab States" after exhaustive discussions of three proposals, namely: The "Arab Alliance", "The Arab Federation" and "The Arab League".22/03/1945Mr. Abdel-Rahman Azzam was appointed Secretary-General of the League of Arab States (1945-1952).05/05/1945The Government of Yemen signed the "Charter in San'aa thus ranking seventh among the founding signatories of the Arab League.10/5/1945Entry into force of "The Charter of the League of Arab States".27/11/1945The "Cultural Treaty among Member States of the League of Arab Sates" was concluded.  This is the first contractual document expressing solidarity among member states and emphasizing the paramount importance of culture in forming Arab public awareness. Hence, member states emphasized, in the preamble of the Treaty, that the objective of this Treaty was to promote "intellectual and spiritual affinity among nationals of Arab countries, promoting universal education and raising the cultural standard of their peoples".29/05/1946Kings and Heads of State of member states of the Arab League held a Summit Conference in "Inshas", Egypt, where they declared their intention to conduct "consultations, cooperation and work in unity and harmony for the welfare of the Arab World", and the "importance of using all possible means to help Arab peoples who are still under foreign rule to gain their freedom and fulfill their national aspirations in order to become active members in the League of Arab States and the United Nations.07/12/1946The "Civil Aviation Treaty among Member States of the Arab League" was declared after its ratification by the Council.  This Treaty was amended more than once to define the air freedoms mentioned in the Articles of the Treaty.09/12/1946The Council of the League of Arab States agreed to establish the "Arab Postal Union" at the LAS General Secretariat.  According to this treaty, member states become one postal region with regard to exchanging letters and postal services.13/04/1950The Council of the League of Arab States announced its approval of the text of the "Joint Defense and Economic Cooperation Treaty" which was later signed by representatives of Syria, Saudi Arabia, Lebanon, Egypt and Yemen on 17/6/1950.  The representatives of Iraq and Jordan, however, signed on 2/2/1951 and 16/2/1952 respectively.  By virtue of this treaty the Economic Council" was established.  This Council later became the "Economic and Social Council" to be entrusted with the achievement of the economic and social objectives of the Arab League and its Specialized Agencies.01/11/1950The League of Arab States received the first real recognition from the United Nations by virtue of a General Assembly Resolution requesting the United Nations Secretary General to invite the Arab League Secretary-General to attend the General Assembly sessions as observer.22/08/1952The "Joint Defense and Economic Cooperation Treaty" entered into force after reaching the required number of ratifications by member sates.  According to Article "13" the Treaty enters into force after fifteen days from the date after at least four member states have deposited their instruments of ratification with the General Secretariat. 14/09/1952An agreement on "Judicial summons and Substitution among members of the League of Arab States", another on "Extradition of Fugitive Criminals" and a third on "The Nationality of Arab nationals in Countries other than their countries of Origin" were concluded. 14/09/1952Mr. Mohamed Abdel-Khalek Hassouna was appointed Secretary-General (1952-1972) of the League of Arab States.28/03//1953Libya joined the League of Arab States.07/09/1953The Council of the League of Arab States adopted the "Agreement on Payments of Commercial Transactions and Transfer of Capital among Member States."  According to this agreement no exceptional fees or taxes are levied on capital transferred from one Arab country to another to prevent its transfer. This agreement was amended later in 1945 and 1959.09/09/1953The Agreement establishing "The Arab Union for Communications and Telecommunications" was concluded.  The Union started its work at its Headquarters in Cairo in 1957 until it was abolished in 1978 to avoid the overlapping of its terms of reference with other LAS specialized organs.28/01/1954The Council of the League of Arab States established an organ for publicity composed of a main Department at the General Secretariat and branch offices abroad.05/04/1954The Council of the League of Arab States approved the "Agreement on Nationality" which regulates cooperation in matters related to nationality and coins a definition for "the Arab Citizen."11/12/1954The Council of the League of Arab States decided to participate with the General Secretariat in the "Bandung Conference on Afro-Asian Solidarity" which laid the foundation for the of Non-Aligned Movement 20/04/1955The Arab Information Centre opened in New York.15/10/1955The Establishment of the "Arab Broadcasting Union" in Cairo.  It was later transferred  to Tunis which became its permanent seat.  The objective of this Union is to strengthen the spirit of Arab fraternity, develop common trends through coordinating programs and activities of Member States broadcasting Services.  It broadened the scope of its activities to include television programs.25/01/1956The Economic Council adopts an agreement on the "Standard Nomenclature of tariffs Among Arab League Member States" in line with the common trend to facilitate commercial exchange and regulate transit trade whose tariff will be fixed according to this table.12/4/1956The Arab League Council approved the text of the "Agreement on Cooperation between the League of Arab States and the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)."13/11/1956An Arab Summit was held in Beirut upon the invitation of the Lebanese Government to express solidarity with Egypt in the wake of the tripartite aggression and to highlight Arab support to the Algerian people in their struggle for independence and freedom.19/1/1957The Republic of the Sudan acceded to the Arab League. 03/6/1957The Economic Council ratified the "Agreement on Economic Unity among Member States of the League of Arab States" which aims at regulating economic relations among member sates until complete economic unity is gradually achieved.  This Agreement should guarantee freedom of mobility of individuals and capital, freedom of exchanging national and foreign goods and products; freedom of residence, work, employment, practicing economic activities; freedom of mobility, transiting and using means of transport, harbors, civil airports; rights of ownership, of making wills and of heritage.  Hence, this agreement was an important and advanced step on the course of achieving effective economic unity whose effects will be felt in the different walks of the life of peoples living in member states. 26/05/1958The "Agreement on Cooperation between the League of Arab States and the International Labor Organization" was signed in Geneva.01/10/1958The Tunisian Republic joined to the League of Arab States.01/10/1958The Kingdom of Morocco joined to the League of Arab States.26/03/1959The Arab League Council agreed to establish the "Standing Committee of Arab Information", composed of heads of Arab Information Agencies. This Committee will be entrusted with drawing up the general policy of joint Arab Information and the coordination of efforts exerted by member states in this field.13/03/1960The "Agreement on the Coordination of Oil Policy" was adopted by Arab League Member States.22/03/1960The Permanent Headquarters of the League of Arab States, located in Tahrir Square, Cairo, was inaugurated on the commemoration of the fifteenth Anniversary of LAS.10/04/1960The Agreement on establishing "The Arab Organization for Social Defense against Crime" in Cairo was approved.   The seat of this Organization was later moved to Rabat in 1981.  This Agreement was amended in 1976 and 1984.  It was later abolished and its terms of reference were entrusted to the General Secretariat of the Council of Arab Ministers of the Interior.30/05/1960A "Cooperation Agreement was signed between the League of Arab States and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)".01/04/1961The Arab League Council approved the Agreement on Establishing the Arab Organization for Administrative Development with the aim of contributing to administrative development in the Arab World so as to serve comprehensive development issues. 20/07/1961The State of Kuwait joined the Arab League22/08/1961A Cooperation Agreement was concluded between the Arab League and the World Health Organization.04/04/1962The Arab League Council agreed to establish an LAS Office in Jerusalem.16/08/1962The Popular, Democratic Republic of Algeria joined to the League of Arab States.21/03/1963The "Agreement on the Civil Aviation Council of Arab Sates" was approved.  It was amended later more that once.25/03/1963Member Sates approved the "Agreement on Exchanging the First and Second Freedoms to Civil Aircrafts" so that aircrafts belonging to any member state would have the right to cross the airspace of any other member state without having to land.  They also have the right to land in international airports for commercial purposes. 20/10/1963The Arab League Council established a Mediation Committee composed of representatives from Tunisia, Lebanon, Libya and Egypt in addition to the Chairman of the Council and the Secretary-General of the League of Arab States to find a peaceful settlement of the dispute between Morocco and Algeria.7/12/1963The "Arab Company for Maritime Navigation" and the "Arab Company for Oil Tankers" were established by  virtue of an Economic Council Resolution.13/01/1964The "First Arab Summit" was held at the General Secretariat of the League of Arab States.  It issued a resolution to convene the Council of Kings and Heads of State of member countries at least once a year.  This decision confers an institutional character on the mechanism of summit conferences due to the absence of any relevant reference in the provisions of the Arab League Charter. 04/03/1964The First Session of the Council of Arab Ministers of Information was held in implementation of the Arab Summit Resolution in January 1964 to draw up an Arab collective information plan to highlight and promote Arab issues.21/05/1964The Council of the League of Arab States approved the "Charter of the Arab Cultural Unity", "the Charter of the Arab Teacher" and the "Constitution of the Arab Education, Culture and Science Organization".  In the text of the Charter of Arab Cultural Unity Member States emphasized that it was a "response to a feeling of natural unity among citizens of the Arab Nation, out of belief in the unity of thought and culture as a basic pillar that support Arab unity.  The preservation of Arab cultural heritage and its transfer to successive generations and its continuous modernization guarantees the coherence of the Arab Nation to enable it play its natural creative role in the domain of human civilization and global peace based on justice, freedom and equality.  05/09/1964The "Second Arab Summit Conference" was held in Alexandria during which it was decided to hold the annual meeting of the "Council of Kings and Heads of State of Member Countries" during the month of September every year.  The Conference welcomed the formation of the Palestine Liberation Organization, and decided to establish the Arab Council for Atomic Research for peaceful purposes and the setting up of an Arab Court of Justice.30/9/1964The Council of the title: About the League
markdown:
# About the League
**Source URL:** http://www.leagueofarabstates.net/en/aboutlas/Pages/Charter.aspx
---

The Charter of the League of Arab States consists of the preamble, 20 articles and three special annexes. The First Annex is on Palestine, stating that "the Council of the League should designate an Arab delegate from Palestine to participate in its work until this country enjoys actual independence". The Second Annex is on Cooperation with Arab Countries that are not Members of the Council of the League. The Third Annex is on the appointment of Mr. Abdel-Rahman Azzam, Minister Plenipotentiary in the Egyptian Foreign Ministry as the First Secretary-General of the League of Arab States for two years.

The preamble noted that the relevant States had approved the Charter to cement and reinforce Arab bonds on the basis of respect for independence and sovereignty to achieve the welfare of all Arab States.

On 22 March 1945, the Charter of the League of Arab States was signed by the delegates of Arab States except Saudi Arabia and Yemen who signed the Charter at a later date. The Palestinian representative parties attended the signing ceremony and 22 March became the date of the annual commemoration of the establishment of the League of Arab States.

The Charter of the League of Arab States.pdf​

The Charter of the League of Arab States (historical copy) .pdf

- The Charter of the League of Arab States
The Charter of the League of Arab States consists of the preamble, 20 articles and three special annexes. The First Annex is on Palestine, stating that "the Council of the League should designate an Arab delegate from Palestine to participate in its work until this country enjoys actual independence". The Second Annex is on Cooperation with Arab Countries that are not Members of the Council of the League. The Third Annex is on the appointment of Mr. Abdel-Rahman Azzam, Minister Plenipotentiary in the Egyptian Foreign Ministry as the First Secretary-General of the League of Arab States for two years. The preamble noted that the relevant States had approved the Charter to cement and reinforce Arab bonds on the basis of respect for independence and sovereignty to achieve the welfare of all Arab States.On 22 March 1945, the Charter of the League of Arab States was signed by the delegates of Arab States except Saudi Arabia and Yemen who signed the Charter at a later date. The Palestinian representative parties attended the signing ceremony and 22 March became the date of the annual commemoration of the establishment of the League of Arab States.The Charter of the League of Arab States.pdf​The Charter of the League of Arab States (historical copy) .pdf

## Links

- [The Charter of the League of Arab States.pdf](http://www.leagueofarabstates.net/en/aboutlas/Documents/The%20Charter%20of%20the%20League%20of%20Arab%20States.pdf)
- [The Charter of the League of Arab States (historical copy) .pdf](http://www.leagueofarabstates.net/en/aboutlas/Documents/الميثاق%20نسخة%20تاريخية.pdf)

Moussa was born on 3 October 1936; he held many positions; he received a number
of decorations, scarves and awards from the countries of the world;

His Excellency Dr. Ahmed
Esmat Abdul Majid was born in Alexandria on March 22, 1923. He held many
positions and received decorations and awards from countries around the world.
He obtained a Bachelor of Laws from the University of Alexandria 1944

Born September 6, 1925 in Tunis, he
received his secondary education at the Sadiq school and then joined Paris to
pursue his higher studies in literature and philosophy at the Sorbonne. And you
get your leave in Arabic language and literature in 1947. He won the Tabriz
debate in 1950.

Born 8 January 1917.

Graduated from the Military Academy
in Egypt in 1936.

He taught Tactics at the Military
College as of 1942.

Law firm from 1921 to 1922. A
prosecutor in Alexandria after his return from the mission from 1925 to 1926.
Accompanying the Egyptian Embassy in Berlin from 1926 to 1927. Chargé
d'affaires of the Egyptian Embassy in Prague from 1927 to 1928.

First Secretary-General of the
League of Arab States.

Abdul Rahman Azzam Pasha was born on
March 8, 1893 in the western Shubak, the center of Ayyat, Giza province of an
Arab family belonging to the Arabian Peninsula. He studied medicine at St.
Thomas College, University of London in 1912.

LAS Council at the Level of Foreign Ministers
Year
2023
2022
League of Arab States Council extraordinary session at the level of foreign ministers addressing political measures to stop the Israeli aggression and achieve security and peace
Date:
11/11/2023
Location: The extraordinary session of the Council of the League of Arab States convened at the level of foreign ministers on 11 October at the headquarters of the League of Arab States' General Secretariat. The session was presided over by His Excellency Mr. Nasser Bourita, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, African Cooperation, and Moroccan Expatriates, who currently serves as the President of the Council. The primary agenda was centred around addressing the Israeli aggression against the Gaza Strip and formulating Arab strategies to halt this aggression.The ministerial-level Council meeting was convened at the request of both the State of Palestine and the Kingdom of Morocco. Discussions during the meeting revolved around the formulation of political strategies at both Arab and international levels to put an end to the Israeli aggression in Gaza. The goal was to establish a foundation for security and peace, adhering to international law and resolutions passed in accordance with international legitimacy.more....The meeting of the Council of the League of Arab States at the ministerial level, 159th Ordinary Session
Date:
08/03/2023
Location: The headquarters of the General Secretariat, CairoDate: 08/03/2023Venue: The headquarters of the General Secretariat, CairoOn 8 March 2023, the ministerial-level Council of the League of Arab States assembled for its 159th ordinary session 159 at the General Secretariat headquarters in Cairo. Presided over by His Excellency Mr. Sameh Shoukry, the Minister of Foreign Affairs for the Arab Republic of Egypt, the Council welcomed the participation of His Excellency the Ministers of Foreign Affairs and heads of delegations from Member States. His Excellency Mr. Ahmed Aboul Gheit, Secretary General of the League of Arab States, was in attendance.At the outset of the session, the Council held a minute of silence to mourn the loss of the martyrs who lost their lives in the devastating earthquakes that struck Turkey and Syria.During the session, the Council approved the agenda consisting of 9 items, which included an item for any new business. In addition, the Council reviewed and studied the submitted decisions, as well as draft decisions that were intended to be presented by the League Council at the level of permanent delegates.The meeting of the League Council at the level of permanent delegates was held on 6 March 2023, presided over by His Excellency Ambassador Mohamed Mustafa Arfi, the Permanent Representative of the Arab Republic of Egypt to the League of Arab States. The League Council meeting was attended by permanent delegates and heads of delegations from member states, in addition to His Excellency Ambassador Hossam Zaki, the Assistant Secretary-General overseeing the Secretariat of the League Council Affairs.On the sidelines of the Council meeting three ministerial committees were convened:The sixth Arab Ministerial Committee tasked with monitoring Turkish interference in the internal affairs of Arab countries.The 19th Quartet Arab Ministerial Committee, responsible for monitoring the developments of the crisis with Iran and devising strategies to address its interference in the internal affairs of Arab countries.The sixth Arab Ministerial Committee, focused on the initiative to halt Israeli measures in the occupied city of Jerusalem.more....Compliance Detailsjavascript:commonShowModalDialog('{SiteUrl}'+

Index of Specialised Arab Organisations
Specialized Arab Organizations DirectoryIntroductionSpecialized Arab Organizations and Arab funding institutions established under the umbrella of the League of Arab States represent the most important pillars of Joint Arab Action, the technical wings of the League and houses of Arab expertise that provide advice and expertise on various issues and economic, social, cultural and financial activities; they play a pivotal role in achieving Arab States' aspirations for cooperation and coordination in all areas of competence relating to Arab citizen and having direct impact on his standards of living and provide decent living for him.  The League of Arab States Secretariat General ( the Department of Arab unions and organizations) has the honour to present the third edition of the Specialized Arab Organizations Directory ( background information) which has become an important and essential reference for interested bodies concerned with joint Arab action institutions The Department of Arab Organizations and UnionsOrganizations and Unions affiliated to the League of Arab States.pdf

About Permanent Arab Committee for Human Rights
Based on the recommendations of the Committee for Political Affairs that "approves the establishment of a Permanent Arab Regional Committee for Human Rights within the scope of the League of Arab States, as per report of the General Secretariat on the subject".  The work of this committee has been regulated and mandated, until 2007, by the Rules of Procedure of Permanent Technical Committees' ,  which regulates all other Permanent Technical Committees, in accordance with Resolution 2487/S51/C4 - issued by the Council of the League of Arab States on 16th March 1969. However, in 2007, according to Resolution 6826 issued by the 128th Ordinary Session   on 5th September, the internal rules of procedure for the Permanent Arab Committee for Human Rights was put into effect. On 13th September 2015, the Rules of Procedure of the Committee was amended pursuant to Resolution 7970 issued by the 144th Ordinary Session of the Council of the League of Arab States at Ministerial Level. ​The amended Rules of
Procedure of the Committee following adoption by the144th Ordinary
Session of the Council of the League of Arab States​.pdf (Available in Arabic)

Arab Summits
Year
2023

Extraordinary joint Arab and Islamic summit	SummitDate: 11/11/2023Location :
City of Riyadh-The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia​The
Kingdom of Saudi Arabia hosted an extraordinary joint Arab and Islamic
summit in the city of Riyadh on 11 November 2023. Chaired by His Royal
Highness Prince Mohamed bin Salman Al Saud, Crown Prince and Prime
Minister, the summit convened to address the Israeli aggression against
the Gaza Strip and other Palestinian territories, as well as the broader
Arab response to the occupation.Prior
to the summit, a preparatory ministerial meeting was held for both
sides to draft resolutions. Tunisia, Algeria, and Iraq expressed
reservations on specific paragraphs. Subsequently, the summit issued the
following resolution:
+
Decisions
joint.pdf ​The resolution of the extraordinary joint Arab summit
+
Speeches of Arabic Leaders
​The address of the Secretary-General at the summit level in Riyadh.pdfThe 32nd Ordinary Arab Summit in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia	SummitDate: 19/05/2023Location :
Jeddah, Saudi ArabiaThe Kingdom of Saudi Arabia will host the 32nd ordinary session of the Council of the League of Arab States at the summit level on 19 May 2023. The Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques, King Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, the King of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, will preside over the summit.The summit's convocation is in observance of the Charter of the League of Arab States, including its aspirations and objectives. Article 3 of the annex to the periodic convening of the League Council at the summit level mandates the regular convening of the Council of the League of Arab States at the summit level, with the ordinary session scheduled for once a year in March.The summit begins its work with preparatory meetings as follows:Sunday, 14/5/2023: The preparatory meeting of senior officials of the Economic and Social Council for the Council of the League of Arab States at the summit level, ordinary session (32).Monday, 15/5/2023: The preparatory meeting of the Economic and Social Council at the ministerial level for the Council of the League of Arab States at the summit level, ordinary session (32).Tuesday, 16/5/2023: The meeting of permanent delegates and senior officials to lay the groundwork for the preparatory meeting of foreign ministers ahead of the summit.Wednesday, 17/5/2023: The preparatory meeting of foreign ministers for the Council of the League of Arab States at the summit level, ordinary session (32).The General Secretariat of the League of Arab States, in coordination with the concerned authorities in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (the host country), completed the organisational and substantive arrangements necessary for the successful holding of this summit in a way that serves common Arab interests and generates a momentum to activate the decisions that will come out of it during the next stage.
+
Decisions
​
+
Speeches of Arabic Leaders

Arab-China Summit
Year
2023
2022
The First Arab-China Summit	SummitDate: 09/12/2022Location :
Riyadh, the Kingdom of Saudi ArabiaThe Kingdom of Saudi Arabia hosted on 9 December 2022 the first Arab-China Summit. Held within the framework of the Arab-China Cooperation Forum, the summit's Arab and Chinese parties agreed at the ninth round of the Ministerial Meeting of the forum on 6 July 2020 to expand Arab-Chinese strategic partnership to serve the interests of both sides and they welcomed the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia's hosting of the summit.The decisions issued by the Council of the League of Arab States at the ministerial level, the most recent of which was Resolution No. 8818 issued by the 158th regular session on 9 June 2022, welcomed the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia's hosting of the first Arab-China Summit, which contributes to advancing Arab-Chinese strategic partnership. Moreover, the summit serves the common interest of the Arab and Chinese sides and improves the mechanisms of the Arab-China Cooperation Forum. The General Secretariat of the League of Arab States was assigned the task of coordinating with the concerned authorities in both the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the People's Republic of China, within the framework of the tripartite preparatory committee, to prepare for this important summit.The General Secretariat of the League of Arab States coordinated with the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the host country, the Chinese side, and the permanent delegations of the member states, to prepare for this important and historic summit.

## Summits

​The Arab world has the potential to become a leader in sustainable energy! the Gulf Organisation for Research and Development (GORD), Global Carbon Council (GCC), the League of Arab States, and the Regional Center for Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency (RCREEE) are joining forces to host a comprehensive workshop exploring pathways for climate mitigation through the energy transition.

Register and join us!

​The League of Arab States has crafted a regional strategy on youth, peace, and security to foster collaborative efforts for peace, stability, and prosperity in Arab countries, empowering the youth in their communities.

​The General Secretariat is organising a 16-day campaign dedicated to combating violence against women. This annual campaign kicks off on 25 November, the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women.

​The General Secretariat of the League of Arab States
presented the Excellence Award for Arab Women to the winners in the field of
technology and innovation in accordance with the decisions of the Arbitration
Committee in 2022.

​The League of Arab States is launching the first Arab regional strategy on youth, peace and security with the support of the United Nations Liaison Office at the League of Arab States, the United Nations Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs, the United Nations Population Fund, the United Nations Development Programme and the Folke Bernadotte Academy.

​The General Secretariat of the League of Arab
States observed the recurrence of legal abuses related to the use of the name
and logo of the League of Arab States by unaffiliated parties. The League has
repeatedly warned about those offences which have caused harm to the image of
the League of Arab States and the individuals who deal with them without
knowing the truth and the extent of their credibility.

| Warning Against the Use of the Name and Logo of the League of Arab States​The General Secretariat of the League of Arab
States observed the recurrence of legal abuses related to the use of the name
and logo of the League of Arab States by unaffiliated parties. The League has
repeatedly warned about those offences which have caused harm to the image of
the League of Arab States and the individuals who deal with them without
knowing the truth and the extent of their credibility. | Warning Against the Use of the Name and Logo of the League of Arab States |  | ​The General Secretariat of the League of Arab
